clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Kidney Injury in Patients With Sickle Cell Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Kidney Injury in Patients With Sickle Cell Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with sickle cell disease may be at risk for acute kidney injury during sickle cell crisis (pain or acute chest syndrome). This study will evaluate blood and urine biomarkers of kidney injury during an admission for crisis and during well clinic follow-up.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients admitted to the hospital for acute chest syndrome or vaso-occlusive pain events may consent to participate in this study. Patients will consent to daily blood and urine collection during their hospitalization and during well clinic visits.
Each AM, participants will have blood and urine collected, processed, and strored for future analysis of biomarkers of injury. Patients will also have strict urine output recorded. Acute kidney injury (AKI) will be defined by the current KDIGO definition based on either a rise in serum creatinine or decline in urine output. Patient medical course will be reviewed to determine interventions and outcomes of their admission based on the development of AKI.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Hospitalizations through study completion, an average of one year
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the incidence of KDIGO defined AKI among patients admitted for pain or acute chest syndrome. AKI is defined by KDIGO as an increase in SCr by 50% or â‰¥0.3mg/dL from baseline, or UOP <0.5mL/kg/hr for 12 hrs

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of Acute Kidney Injury during Pain or Acute Chest Syndrome Hospitalizations on the Development of Chronic Kidney Disease as defined by KDIGO.
primary_outcome.description: We will evaluate the impact of AKI on eGFR. To evaluate this impact, we will compare the change in eGFR, as measured by cystatin C, obtained from each patient during their non-acute clinic visit both immediately prior to their AKI events and after AKI events.

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of free heme and endothelin on development of AKI
primary_outcome.description: We will test the hypothesis that free heme and endothelin are elevated in patients that develop AKI as compared to patients without AKI.

biospec_descr.textblock: Urine and blood will be stored in biorepository.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with HbSS or SB0 thalassemia admitted to Children's of Alabama for a vaso-occlusive pain crisis or acute chest syndrome.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with HbSS or SB0 thalassemia admitted for vaso-occlusive pain crisis or acute chest syndrome
- Able to sign informed consent
